intro: Scorzonera pseudolanata, commonly known as the false scurvygrass, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. The plant produces yellow flowers and has a taproot system that allows it to survive in harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Scorzonera pseudolanata is part of the family Asteraceae, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads.
